title: Social Media Analytics and Reporting Toolkit (SMART)

description.section: TwitIE Named Entity Recongition system research and evaluation - developed Java API on top of GATE Embedded w/TwitIE for automation of entity extraction in microblog corpora to be integrated into future projects

a webapp facilitating the uploading of pictures to be analyzed by Microsoft’s Project Oxford DeepVision API to determine possible emotional indicators of people in the images, coupled with work that extracts a dominant color palette to be considered as input parameters to procedurally generate music fitting the input image’s ‘vibe’ through use of a knowledge base constructed with domain knowledge of harmony and rhythm, coupled with genetic evolutionary algorithms to produce a song in MIDI file format to be returned to the front end view and a displayed score for the user to follow along with.
Recognized by Purdue’s Computer Science department as an exceptional project Spring 2016

title: Impromptune
description: a Java application extending on the feature set of Zong! viewer, while also implementing a dynamic music generation based on the current loaded musical score. We took a static musicXML score viewer and added many features to it while using a Scrum software development methodology.

description.section: Led the back end server development team. Utilized Apache Solr for fast indexing and retrieving large scale trajectory and network data.Established a python based data server that allows the client to query Solr system using Restful API
Implemented Restful APIs that provides functionality for k-means, KDE and group trajectory clustering, in addition to spatial & temporal filtering / sampling.

Explored graph based tweet clustering algorithms based on optimal modularity scores, a greedy random walk of optimal modularity, K cores, and edge betweenness, co-occurrence of words, phrase co - occurrence and semantic role labeling with parse trees to build edges between entities and actions.Topic graph caching for hierarchical term exploration
Our team got an honorable mention award based on this work.

Information Search and Management final research project in developing a query by humming system to detect hummed melodies and match likely songs, using auto correlation, damerau levenshtein, and wuManber edit distance algorithms
an interpreter shell for a simple functional language (in the spirit of LISP) from scratch written in C++ with Flex and Bison
A robust alternative to bash Unix shell written in C++
a web server implemented with threads, thread pooling, and process pooling operating modes written in C/C++ supporting dynamicly loaded libraries
IPv4/IPv6 packet dumper for TCP, UDP, ARP, ICMP packets, multithreaded inflection server, concurrent FTP server, SDN data center simulation / multi-tenant flow restrictions

Built and extended a software rasterizer from scratch for rendering triangles, ray tracing, clipping, depth masking, texture mapping, model space/screen space interpolation, hard / soft shadows, projective textures, reflections, refractions, depth imposters for reflections

title: Purdue EPICS (Engineering Projects In Community Service, APPS - TADA)

description.section: TADA (Technology Assisted Dietary Assessment) Android application aims to provide a simple way to track your daily diet, provide recommendations, while researchers working with project advisor Dr. Edward Delp and VIPER lab students gather geo-tagged data and nutritional habits Implemented functionality to allow multiple UPC barcodes, images of meals to be batch processed by server to determine nutritional content for users Implemented a local datastore for client side caching of personal dietary history
Wave spawning FPS Android game built with Unity to learn basics of programming / game development
